title: EU Leaders Help Ukraine with Money
summary: EU leaders had a long meeting and agreed to give Ukraine a big loan of 90 billion euros to help it fight against Russia. Ukraine needs this money to pay its soldiers and buy weapons because the US is not giving as much help now. All EU countries had to agree, but Hungary, Slovakia, and the Czech Republic only said yes if they did not have to pay. This shows that some countries in Europe are closer to Russia and do not want to help Ukraine as much. Other countries like Poland and the Baltic States think helping Ukraine is very important for keeping Europe safe. They believe if Ukraine loses, Russia might become more dangerous. The loan is a new plan instead of using frozen Russian money. The meeting was tense, but they found a way to help Ukraine.

background_read: The EU is a group of 27 European countries that cooperate on things like trade and laws. Ukraine is a country in Eastern Europe that has been at war with Russia since 2022. Russia invaded Ukraine, and many countries are helping Ukraine with money and weapons to defend itself. Some EU countries have different opinions about Russia, with some being friendlier to it than others. Loans are a common way for countries to help each other in times of need.
Article_Structure: WHO: EU leaders and countries like Hungary, Slovakia, Czech Republic, Poland, and the Baltic States
WHAT: Agreed to give Ukraine a 90 billion euro loan to help it in the war against Russia
WHERE: At an EU summit in Europe
WHY: To support Ukraine financially because it needs money for soldiers and weapons, and to show unity, but there are divisions among EU countries over Russia

perspectives.description: Some EU countries believe helping Ukraine is crucial for European security and to stop Russia from becoming more aggressive.
Other EU countries are closer to Russia and do not want to give as much support to Ukraine, leading to disagreements in the EU.
